definition: elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Man, I am getting to sound as absurd as Zhang Jiehai himself.
sentences.chinese: 老兄啊，我聽起來就快要和張結海一樣荒謬了。

sentences.english: You know it fits, man, when it clicks.
sentences.chinese: 老兄，你會知道扣好了，在它喀擦一聲時。

sentences.english: Man, they sure aren’t like us.
sentences.chinese: 老兄，他們當然和我們不一樣。

sentences.english: And I'd say hey, man, you screwed up.
Roger rolls his eyes. “Dude, you're such a goody-goody.
sentences.chinese: 羅傑眼珠滴溜一轉“老兄，你太虛僞了。

sentences.english: 18—Those are halfcrowns, man, Corley corrected him.
sentences.chinese: “是幾枚半克朗硬幣哩，老兄，”科利糾正他說。

sentences.english: I said "Dave, you're not going to get the ball here."
sentences.chinese: 我說，老兄，你來這想投都沒你份了。
老兄，你就是個喫軟飯的。

sentences.english: Serenade out of tune—you might be swimming solo tonight.
sentences.chinese: 小夜曲唱走調，那雄鯨老兄你今夜就得獨自徘徊了。

sentences.english: Don't worry man. I'm good for it.
sentences.chinese: 老兄，別擔心，我都準備好了。

sentences.english: They are crazy dudes but I love them.
sentences.chinese: 這些老兄可真夠頑固，但是我喜歡。

sentences.english: Man, that English test was a doozy . I think I failed.
sentences.chinese: 老兄，這英文考題太難了，我想我掛了。

sentences.english: B: Don’t worry man. I’m good for it.
sentences.chinese: 老兄，別擔心，我都準備好了。

sentences.english: So, big dawg , I'm just going to chill in here and study, all right?
sentences.chinese: 所以，老兄，我就只是安靜地在這學習，行嗎？

sentences.english: Dude, you see my camera anywhere?-No, man.

definition: (affectionate form of address for a male who is not very much younger than oneself) my boy/old pal
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
brother (polite appellation for a friend one's age)
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
You're really quite something!/You're just amazing!
